description: The stationAlarm trap is generated when a Niagara alarm is received
by an snmp recipient which has routing alarms to a network manager
enabled. It contains useful information from the alarm record.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD TRIDIUMR3-MIB::stationAlarm TRIDIUMR3-MIB::timestamp s EXAMPLE TRIDIUMR3-MIB::uuid s EXAMPLE TRIDIUMR3-MIB::sourceState i 0 TRIDIUMR3-MIB::ackState i 0 TRIDIUMR3-MIB::ackRequired i 0 TRIDIUMR3-MIB::source s EXAMPLE TRIDIUMR3-MIB::alarmClass s EXAMPLE TRIDIUMR3-MIB::priority i 0 TRIDIUMR3-MIB::normalTime s EXAMPLE TRIDIUMR3-MIB::ackTime s EXAMPLE TRIDIUMR3-MIB::user s EXAMPLE TRIDIUMR3-MIB::alarmData s EXAMPLE TRIDIUMR3-MIB::alarmTransition i 0 TRIDIUMR3-MIB::lastUpdate s EXAMPLE

description: Indicates the time when the alarm occurred.
variables.name: TRIDIUMR3-MIB::timestamp

description: The unique universal identifier of the alarm.
variables.name: TRIDIUMR3-MIB::uuid

description: The current state of the source. normal(0), offnormal(1), fault(2), or alert(3).
variables.name: TRIDIUMR3-MIB::sourceState

description: Indicates if the alarm has been acknowledged. acked(0), unacked(1), or ackPending(2).
Alarm can be acknowledged by setting ackState to 'acked'(0)
variables.name: TRIDIUMR3-MIB::ackState

description: Indicates if an acknowledgement is required for the alarm. false(0), or true(1).
variables.name: TRIDIUMR3-MIB::ackRequired

description: Indicates the path to the station object which generated the alarm.
variables.name: TRIDIUMR3-MIB::source

description: The alarm class for the alarm.
variables.name: TRIDIUMR3-MIB::alarmClass

description: The priority of the alarm (0=high, 255=low).
variables.name: TRIDIUMR3-MIB::priority

description: The time at which the alarm goes back to normal state.
variables.name: TRIDIUMR3-MIB::normalTime

description: The time at which the alarm is acked. Note that
interpretation of this value depends upon the state of the alarm.
variables.name: TRIDIUMR3-MIB::ackTime

description: The name of the user who acknowledged the alarm.
variables.name: TRIDIUMR3-MIB::user

description: A string containing dynamic alarm data, in key-value pairs.
variables.name: TRIDIUMR3-MIB::alarmData

description: The initial state of the source. normal(0), offnormal(1), fault(2), or alert(3).
variables.name: TRIDIUMR3-MIB::alarmTransition

description: The time at which the alarm was last updated. Updates occur
at creation, acknowlegement, and changes to alarmData such as notes.
variables.name: TRIDIUMR3-MIB::lastUpdate
